Emerging growth company &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the Registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act . &#9744; Item 5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. The 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareholders (the &#8220;Annual Meeting&#8221;) of Apple Inc. (&#8220;Apple&#8221;) was held on &#160; February 25, 2025. At the Annual Meeting, Apple&#8217;s shareholders voted on the following seven proposals and cast their votes as described below. 1. The individuals listed below were elected at the Annual Meeting to serve as directors of Apple until the next annual meeting of shareholders and until their successors are duly elected and qualified: &#160; &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote Wanda Austin &#160; 9,072,076,816 &#160; 40,131,307 &#160; 29,197,385 &#160; 3,038,264,304 Tim Cook &#160; 8,970,310,928 &#160; 153,141,693 &#160; 17,952,887 &#160; 3,038,264,304 Alex Gorsky &#160; 8,946,626,018 &#160; 165,324,875 &#160; 29,454,615 &#160; 3,038,264,304 Andrea Jung &#160; 8,546,796,776 &#160; 565,487,160 &#160; 29,121,572 &#160; 3,038,264,304 Art Levinson &#160; 8,479,896,928 &#160; 633,590,301 &#160; 27,918,279 &#160; 3,038,264,304 Monica Lozano &#160; 9,024,832,308 &#160; 87,408,524 &#160; 29,164,676 &#160; 3,038,264,304 Ron Sugar &#160; 8,632,486,843 &#160; 478,710,182 &#160; 30,208,483 &#160; 3,038,264,304 Sue Wagner &#160; 8,744,107,302 &#160; 368,677,410 &#160; 28,620,796 &#160; 3,038,264,304 2. A management proposal to ratify the appointment of Ernst &amp; Young LLP as Apple&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2025 was approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained 11,910,666,249 &#160; 221,074,424 &#160; 47,929,139 3. An advisory resolution to approve executive compensation was approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 8,397,138,183 &#160; 691,312,529 &#160; 52,954,796 &#160; 3,038,264,304 4. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Report on Ethical AI Data Acquisition and Usage&#8221; was not approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 1,041,899,819 &#160; 7,963,197,675 &#160; 136,308,014 &#160; 3,038,264,304 5. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Report on Costs and Benefits of Child Sex Abuse Material-Identifying Software &amp; User Privacy&#8221; was not approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 802,117,145 &#160; 8,198,486,901 &#160; 140,801,462 &#160; 3,038,264,304 6. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Request to Cease DEI Efforts&#8221; was not approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 210,451,697 &#160; 8,843,175,086 &#160; 87,778,725 &#160; 3,038,264,304 7. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Report on Charitable Giving&#8221; was not approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 169,119,141 &#160; 8,884,470,350 &#160; 87,816,017 &#160; 3,038,264,304 SIGNATURE Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized. Date: February 25, 2025 Apple Inc.&#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; By: /s/ Katherine Adams &#160; &#160; Katherine Adams &#160; &#160; Senior Vice President, &#160; &#160; General Counsel and Secretary
